013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ObjectUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import static java.util.Arrays.*;
020
021import java.io.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.function.*;
024import java.util.stream.*;
025
026import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
029
030/**
031 * Used for fluent assertion calls against array objects.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='topic'>Test Methods</h5>
034 * <p>
035 * <ul class='javatree'>
036 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion}
037 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
038 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isHas(Object[]) isHas(Object[])}
039 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
040 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isAny(Predicate) isAny(Predicate)}
041 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isAll(Predicate) isAll(Predicate)}
042 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isEmpty() isEmpty()}
043 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isNotEmpty() isNotEmpty()}
044 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isSize(int size) isSize(int size)}
045 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isContains(Object) isContains(Object)}
046 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#isNotContains(Object) isNotContains(Object)}
047 *    </ul>
048 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
049 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
050 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExists() isExists()}
051 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Object) is(Object)}
052 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
053 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNot(Object) isNot(Object)}
054 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isAny(Object...) isAny(Object...)}
055 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotAny(Object...) isNotAny(Object...)}
056 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNull() isNull()}
057 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotNull() isNotNull()}
058 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isString(String) isString(String)}
059 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isJson(String) isJson(String)}
060 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSame(Object) isSame(Object)}
061 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameJsonAs(Object) isSameJsonAs(Object)}
062 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSortedJsonAs(Object) isSameSortedJsonAs(Object)}
063 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer) isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer)}
064 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isType(Class) isType(Class)}
065 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExactType(Class) isExactType(Class)}
066 *    </ul>
067 * </ul>
068 *
069 * <h5 class='topic'>Transform Methods</h5>
070 * <p>
071 * <ul class='javatree'>
072 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion}
073 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
074 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asStrings() asStrings()}
075 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asStrings(Function) asStrings(Function)}
076 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asCdl() asCdl()}
077 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asCdl(Function) asCdl(Function)}
078 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asBeanList() asBeanList()}
079 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asItem(int) asItem(int)}
080 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asSorted() asSorted()}
081 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentArrayAssertion#asSorted(Comparator) asSorted(Comparator)}
082 *    </ul>
083 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
084 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
085 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString() asString()}
086 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(WriterSerializer) asString(WriterSerializer)}
087 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(Function) asString(Function)}
088 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJson() asJson()}
089 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJsonSorted() asJsonSorted()}
090 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asTransformed(Function) asApplied(Function)}
091 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asAny() asAny()}
092 * </ul>
093 * </ul>
094 *
095 * <h5 class='topic'>Configuration Methods</h5>
096 * <p>
097 * <ul class='javatree'>
098 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Assertion}
099 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
100 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setMsg(String, Object...) setMsg(String, Object...)}
101 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setOut(PrintStream) setOut(PrintStream)}
102 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setSilent() setSilent()}
103 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setStdOut() setStdOut()}
104 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setThrowable(Class) setThrowable(Class)}
105 *    </ul>
106 * </ul>
107 *
108 * <ul class='seealso'>
109 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
110 * </ul>
111 *
112 * @param <E> The entry type.
113 * @param <R> The return type.
114 */
115@FluentSetters(returns="FluentArrayAssertion<E,R>")
116public class FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> extends FluentObjectAssertion<E[],R> {
117
118   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
119   // Static
120   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
121
122   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(FluentArrayAssertion.class, "Messages");
123   private static final String
124      MSG_arrayWasNotEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("arrayWasNotEmpty"),
125      MSG_arrayWasEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("arrayWasEmpty"),
126      MSG_arrayUnexpectedSize = MESSAGES.getString("arrayUnexpectedSize"),
127      MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue"),
128      MSG_arrayContainedUnexpectedValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayContainedUnexpectedValue"),
129      MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt"),
130      MSG_arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue"),
131      MSG_arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt = MESSAGES.getString("arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt");
132
133   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134   // Instance
135   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
136
137   /**
138    * Constructor.
139    *
140    * @param value
141    *    The object being tested.
142    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
143    * @param returns
144    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
145    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
146    * used on the same assertion.
147    */
148   public FluentArrayAssertion(E[] value, R returns) {
149      this(null, value, returns);
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Chained constructor.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.
157    *
158    * @param creator
159    *    The assertion that created this assertion.
160    *    <br>Should be <jk>null</jk> if this is the top-level assertion.
161    * @param value
162    *    The object being tested.
163    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
164    * @param returns
165    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
166    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
167    * used on the same assertion.
168    */
169   public FluentArrayAssertion(Assertion creator, E[] value, R returns) {
170      super(creator, value, returns);
171   }
172
173   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
174   // Transform methods
175   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
176
177   @Override /* FluentObjectAssertion */
178   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> asTransformed(Function<E[],E[]> function) {
179      return new FluentArrayAssertion<>(this, function.apply(orElse(null)), returns());
180   }
181
182   @Override /* FluentBaseAssertion */
183   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asString() {
184      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, toString(), returns());
185   }
186
187   /**
188    * Converts this assertion into a {@link FluentListAssertion} of strings.
189    *
190    * @return A new fluent string assertion.
191    */
192   public FluentStringListAssertion<R> asStrings() {
193      return new FluentStringListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : stream(value()).map(x -> stringify(x)).collect(Collectors.toList()), returns());
194   }
195
196   /**
197    * Runs the stringify function against all values in this list and returns it as a fluent string list assertion.
198    *
199    * @param function The function to apply to all values in this list.
200    * @return A new fluent string list assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
201    */
202   public FluentStringListAssertion<R> asStrings(Function<E,String> function) {
203      List<String> l = valueIsNull() ? null : stream(value()).map(x -> function.apply(x)).collect(Collectors.toList());
204      return new FluentStringListAssertion<>(this, l, returns());
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Converts the entries in this list to a simple comma-delimited list and returns the value as a fluent string assertion.
209    *
210    * @return A fluent string assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
211    */
212   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asCdl() {
213      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : StringUtils.join(value(), ','), returns());
214   }
215
216   /**
217    * Converts the entries to strings using the specified stringify function, combines them into a simple comma-delimited list, and returns the value as a fluent string assertion.
218    *
219    * @param function The function to apply to all values in this list.
220    * @return A fluent string assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
221    */
222   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asCdl(Function<E,String> function) {
223      List<String> l = valueIsNull() ? null : stream(value()).map(x -> function.apply(x)).collect(Collectors.toList());
224      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, join(l, ','), returns());
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Converts this assertion into a {@link FluentBeanListAssertion}.
229    *
230    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
231    * <p class='bjava'>
232    *    <jc>// Extracts the 'foo' property from an array of beans and validates their values.</jc>.
233    *    <jsm>assertObject</jsm>(<jv>myArrayOfBeans</jv>)
234    *       .asBeanList()
235    *       .asProperty(<js>"foo"</js>)
236    *       .asSorted()
237    *       .equals(<js>"value1"</js>,<js>"value2"</js>,<js>"value3"</js>);
238    * </p>
239    *
240    * @return A new fluent string assertion.
241    */
242   public FluentBeanListAssertion<E,R> asBeanList() {
243      return new FluentBeanListAssertion<>(this, toList(), returns());
244   }
245
246   /**
247    * Returns an object assertion on the item specified at the specified index.
248    *
249    * <p>
250    * If the array is <jk>null</jk> or the index is out-of-bounds, the returned assertion is a null assertion
251    * (meaning {@link FluentAnyAssertion#isExists()} returns <jk>false</jk>).
252    *
253    * @param index The index of the item to retrieve from the array.
254    * @return A new assertion.
255    */
256   public FluentAnyAssertion<E,R> asItem(int index) {
257      return new FluentAnyAssertion<>(this, at(index), returns());
258   }
259
260   /**
261    * Sorts the entries in this list.
262    *
263    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
264    */
265   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asSorted() {
266      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, toSortedList(null), returns());
267   }
268
269   /**
270    * Sorts the entries in this list using the specified comparator.
271    *
272    * @param comparator The comparator to use to sort the list.
273    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
274    */
275   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asSorted(Comparator<E> comparator) {
276      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, toSortedList(comparator), returns());
277   }
278
279   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
280   // Test methods
281   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
282
283   /**
284    * Asserts that the contents of this list contain the specified values.
285    *
286    * @param entries The expected entries in this list.
287    * @return This object.
288    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
289    */
290   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
291   public R isHas(E...entries) throws AssertionError {
292      assertArgNotNull("entries", entries);
293      Predicate<E>[] p = stream(entries).map(AssertionPredicates::eq).toArray(Predicate[]::new);
294      return is(p);
295   }
296
297   /**
298    * Asserts that the contents of this list pass the specified tests.
299    *
300    * @param tests The tests to run.  <jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
301    * @return This object.
302    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
303    */
304   @SafeVarargs
305   public final R is(Predicate<E>...tests) throws AssertionError {
306      isSize(tests.length);
307      for (int i = 0, j = length(); i < j; i++) {
308         Predicate<E> t = tests[i];
309         if (t != null)
310            if (! t.test(at(i)))
311               throw error(MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt, i, getFailureMessage(t, at(i)));
312      }
313      return returns();
314   }
315
316   /**
317    * Asserts that at least one value in the array passes the specified test.
318    *
319    * @param test The predicate test.
320    * @return The fluent return object.
321    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed or value was <jk>null</jk>.
322    */
323   public R isAny(Predicate<E> test) throws AssertionError {
324      assertArgNotNull("test", test);
325      for (E v : value())
326         if (test.test(v))
327            return returns();
328      throw error(MSG_arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue, (Object)value());
329   }
330
331   /**
332    * Asserts that all values in the array passes the specified test.
333    *
334    * @param test The predicate test.
335    * @return The fluent return object.
336    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed or value was <jk>null</jk>.
337    */
338   public R isAll(Predicate<E> test) throws AssertionError {
339      assertArgNotNull("test", test);
340      for (int i = 0, j = length(); i < j; i++)
341         if (! test.test(at(i)))
342            throw error(MSG_arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt, i, getFailureMessage(test, at(i)));
343      return returns();
344   }
345
346   /**
347    * Asserts that the collection exists and is empty.
348    *
349    * @return The fluent return object.
350    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
351    */
352   public R isEmpty() throws AssertionError {
353      if (length() != 0)
354         throw error(MSG_arrayWasNotEmpty);
355      return returns();
356   }
357
358   /**
359    * Asserts that the collection exists and is not empty.
360    *
361    * @return The fluent return object.
362    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
363    */
364   public R isNotEmpty() throws AssertionError {
365      if (length() == 0)
366         throw error(MSG_arrayWasEmpty);
367      return returns();
368   }
369
370   /**
371    * Asserts that the collection exists and is the specified size.
372    *
373    * @param size The expected size.
374    * @return The fluent return object.
375    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
376    */
377   public R isSize(int size) throws AssertionError {
378      if (length() != size)
379         throw error(MSG_arrayUnexpectedSize, size, length());
380      return returns();
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Asserts that the array contains the expected value.
385    *
386    * @param entry The value to check for.
387    * @return The fluent return object.
388    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
389    */
390   public R isContains(E entry) throws AssertionError {
391      for (int i = 0, j = length(); i < j; i++)
392         if (eq(at(i), entry))
393            return returns();
394      throw error(MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue, entry, toString());
395   }
396
397   /**
398    * Asserts that the array does not contain the expected value.
399    *
400    * @param entry The value to check for.
401    * @return The fluent return object.
402    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
403    */
404   public R isNotContains(E entry) throws AssertionError {
405      for (int i = 0, j = length(); i < j; i++)
406         if (eq(at(i), entry))
407            throw error(MSG_arrayContainedUnexpectedValue, entry, toString());
408      return returns();
409   }
410
411   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
412   // Fluent setters
413   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
414
415   // <FluentSetters>
416
417   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
418   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> setMsg(String msg, Object...args) {
419      super.setMsg(msg, args);
420      return this;
421   }
422
423   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
424   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> setOut(PrintStream value) {
425      super.setOut(value);
426      return this;
427   }
428
429   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
430   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> setSilent() {
431      super.setSilent();
432      return this;
433   }
434
435   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
436   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> setStdOut() {
437      super.setStdOut();
438      return this;
439   }
440
441   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
442   public FluentArrayAssertion<E,R> setThrowable(Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value) {
443      super.setThrowable(value);
444      return this;
445   }
446
447   // </FluentSetters>
448
449   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
450   // Utility methods
451   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
452
453   private int length() {
454      return value().length;
455   }
456
457   private List<E> toList() {
458      return valueIsNull() ? null : list(value());
459   }
460
461   private List<E> toSortedList(Comparator<E> comparator) {
462      return valueIsNull() ? null : sortedList(comparator, value());
463   }
464
465   private E at(int index) {
466      return valueIsNull() || index >= length() || index < 0 ? null : value()[index];
467   }
468
469   @Override
470   public String toString() {
471      return valueIsNull() ? null : Arrays.toString(value());
472   }
473}
